alert.note: Alert for Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 3:46PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN LICKING COUNTY THROUGH 430 PM EDT... At 346 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Centerburg, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, half inch hail, and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Utica, Hartford, St. Louisville, Purity, US Route 62 at State Route 661 and Fallsburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
